item.title: Retelling the Past: Imperfect vs. Preterite
item.description: Unlike English, Spanish has two types of past tenses, the imperfect and the preterite. Here’s a detailed guide to both of these tenses. Imperfect (el imperfecto) The imperfect is appropriate when the usage applies to a time range in the past. Imperfect Conjugation Remove the ending (-ar, -er, or -ir) to get the verb stem, then add the corresponding suffix. -ar verbs Subject -ar ending yo -aba tú -abas él/ella/Ud.
